scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This forty-eight item collection of papers of Thomas K. Harnsberger, 1912-1933 and n.d., contains petroleum reports, oil and geological maps, notes, a petroleum survey, printed material, and a letter to Harnsberger (February 29, 1928) as a stockholder in the E.I. Du Pont DeNemours Company.

The printed material pertains to the following topics: natural gas; oil development in Oklahoma; the oil business; a balance sheet for White Motor Securities Corporation; stockholders letters and statements from the International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation; statements of the National City Bank of New York; report of the Kirby Petroleum Company; report of the White Motor Company; gas lifts; stockholders annual report from the National Bellas Hess Company; report regarding the Marland Oil Company; a balance sheet for Chrysler Corporation; a form letter to Packardstockholders; International Paper Company; "The Growth of Chrysler"; Fenner and Beane; "Remarkable Experiences of H. F. Sinclair with His Government" by Robert L. Owen; "Maps, Charts, Well Logs, Tables, Cross Sections, Etc."; code of ethics from the American Association of Petroleum Geologists; "A Bearish Chronicle of Some Bulls"; and a bank investment plan.

The organization of this collection is chronological, excluding the printed material which has been filed together in the last folder. A biographical sketch of Thomas Kennerly Harnsberger(1889-1934) can be found in the control folder.
